problems.title: Linear Search
problems.description:
Problem Statement
Implement the Linear Search algorithm to find the index of a target element K in an array of N integers. 

Linear Search works by checking each element of the array one by one until the target element is found or the end of the array is reached.

Input Format
- First line: Two space-separated integers N (number of elements) and K (target element).
- Second line: N space-separated integers.

Output Format
- Print the 0-based index of the target element if it is found.
- If the element is not present, print -1.

Example 1
Input:
5 30
10 20 30 40 50

Output:
2

Example 2
Input:
4 100
10 20 30 40

Output:
-1
hintsList: Start from the first element and compare it with K.
If it matches, return the current index.
If you reach the end of the array without a match, return -1.
